meanings.definition: To break up or dissolve (a group or organization)
meanings.sent1: The team disbanded after the season ended.
meanings.sent2: The club disbanded due to lack of funding.
meanings.sent3: The ants disbanded their march when they found a sugar cube.
meanings.sent4: The clouds disbanded, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces disbanded as the child solved it.

meanings.definition: To disperse or scatter (members of a group)
meanings.sent1: The protesters disbanded peacefully after their message was heard.
meanings.sent2: The crowd disbanded into smaller groups after the concert.
meanings.sent3: The birds disbanded from the tree when the cat approached.
meanings.sent4: The fog slowly disbanded as the sun rose.
meanings.sent5: The students disbanded after the bell rang for recess.
